text: Bildad’s First Response to Job
Then\f + \fr 8:1 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* Bildad the Shuhite answered and said,\f + \fr 8:1 \ft Hebrew “he said” \f*
“⸤How long⸥\f + \fr 8:2 \ft Literally “Until when” \f* will you say these \add things\add*,
and the words of your mouth \add be\add* a mighty wind?
Does God pervert justice,
⸤or⸥\f + \fr 8:3 \ft Literally “and if” \f* Shaddai pervert righteousness?
If your children sinned against him,
then\f + \fr 8:4 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* he sent them into the ⸤power⸥\f + \fr 8:4 \ft Literally “hand” \f* of their transgression.
If you yourself\f + \fr 8:5 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun \f* would seek God,
then\f + \fr 8:5 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* you would plead to Shaddai for grace.
If you \add are\add* pure and upright,
indeed,\f + \fr 8:6 \ft Or “even,” or “yes” \f* now he will rouse himself for you,
and he will restore your righteous abode.
Though\f + \fr 8:7 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* your beginning was small,
your end\f + \fr 8:7 \ft Hebrew “and your end” \f* will be very great.
“Indeed,\f + \fr 8:8 \ft Or “For” \f* please inquire of former generations,
and consider ⸤what their ancestors have found⸥,\f + \fr 8:8 \ft Literally “\fq as \ft to the finding of their fathers” \f*
for we \add are of\add* yesterday, and we do not know,
for our days on earth \add are\add* a shadow.
Will they themselves\f + \fr 8:10 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun \f* not teach you \add and\add* ⸤tell you⸥\f + \fr 8:10 \ft Literally “they will say to you” \f*
and ⸤utter⸥\f + \fr 8:10 \ft Literally “they will bring out” \f* words from their heart?
Can papyrus grow tall where \add there is\add* not a marsh?
Will reeds flourish without water?\f + \fr 8:11 \ft Or “\fq where there is \ft no water” \f*
While it \add is\add* in its flower \add and\add* is not plucked,
yet\f + \fr 8:12 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* it withers ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 8:12 \ft Literally “to the faces of” \f* all grass.
So \add are\add* the paths of all who forget God;
and \add the\add* hope of \add the\add* godless will perish,
whose confidence is cut off
and ⸤whose trust⸥\f + \fr 8:14 \ft Literally “his trust” \f* \add is\add* a spider’s house.
He will lean himself against his house, but\f + \fr 8:15 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* it will not stand;
he will take hold of it, but\f + \fr 8:15 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* it will not endure.
He \add is\add* ⸤thriving⸥\f + \fr 8:16 \ft Literally “soaked,” or “well-watered” \f* ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 8:16 \ft Literally “to the faces of” \f* the sun,
and his plant shoots spread over his garden.
His roots twine over a stone heap;
he sees a house of stone.
If he destroys him from his place,
then\f + \fr 8:18 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* it deceives him, \add saying\add*, ‘I have never seen you.’
Look, this \add is\add* the joy of his way,
and from dust others will spring up.
“Look, God will not reject \add the\add* blameless,
and he will not uphold the hand of evildoers.
Yet he will fill your mouth \add with\add* laughter
and your lips \add with\add* a shout of joy.
\add Those\add* who hate you will be clothed with shame,
and the tent of the wicked ⸤will be no more⸥.”\f + \fr 8:22 \ft Literally “there is not it,” or “it is not” \f*
